topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5495c57c636872169ff90600#post_5495c57c636872169ff90600
I remember reading Sin City before I knew he'd gone insane and reading a line thought by Marv where he speculates that his lesbian parole officer just hasn't met the right man yet, and at the time my thought was "this is actually some pretty good writing of an ignorant if well meaning man!"

Now its more like "fuck me, this is how Miller actually thinks and he's getting worse!"

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5495c79c6368725587d80700#post_5495c79c6368725587d80700
That reminds me of line I saw on Tumblr of all places that I really wanna use one day. And I'm paraphrasing here.
"You're not a lesbian, you just haven't met the right man."
"And you're attracted to llamas."
"I'm not attracted to llamas."
"Well that's only because you haven't met the right llama yet.

But yeah at this point one has to wonder if Franky-boy isn't intentionally sabotaging his career.

topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
Although there is a funny story surroounding the mother's ring.
For about three weeks my mom was convinced that I didn't get her anything. Every time I would go over to her place she'd ask "so what did you get me for Christmas." I'd say "the same thing I got you last year. Nothin'." And then on Christmas morning I hid the wrapped box at the very back of the tree when no one was looking. So after everyone had opened their gifts my step-dad looked under the tree and noticed there was one left. It said "To mom, from Santa" on the sticker. She opened the box and saw her ring for the first time and she actually started CRYING.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
